page.title: 01Topology and Location.
page.content: Our D_block area is to the west of Spilsby. It is situated in the south east corner of the Lincolnshire Wolds; a range of chalk hills extending from the Humber to the Fens. The appearance is of rolling hills, lightly wooded in places but otherwise covered with crops and pasture and scattered with farms. There are three small villages and a market town. Traditionally, this is an area of cattle and sheep, due to the thinness of soil over the chalk. However, this has recently been changed with the advent of oil based fertilizers and pesticides. Now the land is arable and produces wheat and other cash crops. Most people think of Lincolnshire as everlasting flat lands. For this reason, the beauty of this area comes as a suprise and delight with its rolling hills trees and hidden valleys
